definition: loud thunder, but only tiny drops of rain (idiom); a lot of talk, but no action/action speaks louder than words/his bite is worse than his bark
pinyin: lei2 sheng1 da4 , yu3 dian3 xiao3

sentences.english: A big thunder, lightning a good light, the wind is also very fierce.
sentences.chinese: 雷聲好大，閃電好亮，風也很猛。

sentences.english: Her shriek was dulled by the loud crash of thunder.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫聲在震耳的雷聲中變得低沉了。

sentences.english: Thunder roared and shook the earth.

sentences.chinese: 閃電和雷聲逐漸地減小了。
遠處雷聲咕隆咕隆地響。

sentences.english: Collects the golden company to increase holds is the thunderclap big raindrop is small.
sentences.chinese: 匯金公司的增持更是雷聲大雨點小。

sentences.english: It thunders and the wind rushes screaming through the void.
sentences.chinese: 雷聲在響，狂風怒吼着穿過天空。

sentences.english: Raytheon is part of prime contractor Northrop Grumman's NPOESS team.
sentences.chinese: 雷聲公司是主合同商諾格NPOESS團隊的一部分。

sentences.english: The ACES equipment represents the latest in Raytheon's developmentally mature aircraft self-protection technology.
sentences.chinese: ACES裝備代表了雷聲公司最新的飛機自防禦技術。

sentences.english: They heard thunder muttering among the hills.
sentences.chinese: 他們聽見山中雷聲隆隆。

sentences.english: Raytheon officials have declined to comment on the issue at this time.
sentences.chinese: 雷聲公司的官員此時拒絕評論該問題。

sentences.english: Flashes of lightning illuminated the scene and thunder rolled in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 閃電照亮了現場，雷聲從遠處滾來。

sentences.english: There was a thunderclap, and the genie declared, "Your wish has been granted."
sentences.chinese: 在滾滾雷聲中，妖怪宣佈，“你的願望已經實現了。”

sentences.english: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.
sentences.chinese: 神發出奇妙的雷聲，他行大事，我們不能測透。

sentences.english: That was the loudest thunderclap I've ever heard.
sentences.chinese: 這是我聽過最響的雷聲。

definition: sudden clap of thunder/fig. surprising turn of events
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
